customPlugin.description: Please visit the edit page to view details
customPlugin.title: This is a Custom Plugin

emptyState.description: Please install this plugin first to view its capabilities and configuration options
emptyState.title: View Plugin Details After Installation

dev.confirmDeleteDevPlugin: Are you sure you want to delete this local plugin? Once deleted, it cannot be recovered.

useProxy.label: Install via proxy (if encountering cross-origin access errors, try enabling this option and reinstalling)

identifier.desc: The unique identifier of the plugin
identifier.label: Identifier

args.desc: A list of parameters to be passed to the execution command, typically the MCP server name or the path to the startup script.
args.label: Command Parameters

auth.desc: Select the authentication method for the MCP server
auth.label: Authentication Type

token.desc: Enter your API Key or Bearer Token
token.label: API Key

command.desc: The executable file or script used to start the MCP STDIO Server
command.label: Command
command.placeholder: For example: npx / uv / docker, etc.

desc.desc: Add a description for the plugin
desc.label: Plugin Description
desc.placeholder: Provide usage instructions and context for this plugin

endpoint.desc: Enter the address of your MCP Streamable HTTP Server
endpoint.label: MCP Endpoint URL

env.desc: Enter the environment variables required for your MCP Server
env.formValidationFailed: Form validation failed, please check the parameter format
env.label: MCP Server Environment Variables
env.stringifyError: Unable to serialize parameters, please check the parameter format

identifier.desc: Specify a name for your MCP plugin, using English characters
identifier.invalid: Only English letters, numbers, - and _ are allowed
identifier.label: MCP Plugin Name
identifier.required: Please enter the MCP service identifier

mcp.stdioNotSupported: The current environment does not support stdio type MCP plugins
mcp.testConnectionTip: The MCP plugin can only be used normally after a successful connection test

type.desc: Select the communication method for the MCP plugin; the web version only supports Streamable HTTP
type.httpFeature1: Compatible with both web and desktop versions
type.httpFeature2: Connect to a remote MCP server without additional installation or configuration
type.label: MCP Plugin Type
type.stdioFeature1: Lower communication latency, suitable for local execution
type.stdioFeature2: Requires local installation and running of the MCP server
type.stdioNotAvailable: STDIO mode is only available in the desktop version
type.stdioShortDesc: A communication protocol based on standard input and output
type.title: MCP Plugin Type

url.desc: Enter your MCP Server Streamable HTTP address, SSE mode is not supported.
url.label: HTTP Endpoint URL
url.required: Please enter the MCP service URL

avatar.desc: The icon of the plugin, can be an Emoji or a URL
avatar.label: Icon

identifier.desc: The unique identifier of the plugin, only supports alphanumeric characters, hyphen -, and underscore _
identifier.errorDuplicate: The identifier is already used by another plugin, please modify the identifier
identifier.label: Identifier
identifier.pattenErrorMessage: Only alphanumeric characters, hyphen -, and underscore _ are allowed

manifest.desc: {{appName}} will install the plugin through this link.
manifest.label: Plugin Description (Manifest) URL

dev.modalDesc: After adding a custom plugin, it can be used for plugin development verification or directly in the session. Please refer to the <1>development documentationâ†—</> for plugin development.

api.noResults: No APIs found matching the search criteria

empty.desc: Once configured, you will be able to preview the capabilities supported by the plugin here
empty.title: Start Previewing After Configuring the Plugin

error.fetchError: Failed to fetch the manifest link. Please ensure the link is valid and allows cross-origin access.
error.manifestInvalid:
The manifest does not conform to the specification. Validation result: 

 {{error}}
error.urlError: The link did not return content in JSON format. Please ensure it is a valid link.

mcpInstall.CONFIGURATION_REQUIRED: Please complete the necessary configuration before continuing the installation
mcpInstall.configurationDescription: This MCP plugin requires configuration parameters to function properly. Please fill in the necessary configuration information.
mcpInstall.dependenciesDescription: This plugin requires the following system dependencies to work properly. Please install the missing dependencies as instructed, then click recheck to continue the installation.
mcpInstall.dependenciesRequired: Please install the plugin's system dependencies

detail.tooLong: The text content is too long; only the first {{characters}} characters of the conversation context will be retained, and the excess will not be included in the conversation context.

searchxng.description: Enter the URL for SearchXNG to start online searching
searchxng.title: Configure SearchXNG Search Engine
searchxng.unconfiguredDesc: Please contact the administrator to complete the SearchXNG search engine configuration to start online searching
searchxng.unconfiguredTitle: SearchXNG search engine not configured yet

settings.envConfigDescription: These configurations will be passed as environment variables to the process when the MCP server starts
settings.httpTypeNotice: No environment variables need to be configured for HTTP type MCP plugins

indexUrl.title: Marketplace Index
indexUrl.tooltip: Editing is not supported at the moment

settings.modalDesc: After configuring the address of the plugin marketplace, you can use a custom plugin marketplace
settings.title: Configure Plugin Marketplace

showInPortal: Please check the details in the Portal view

actions.confirmUninstall: The plugin is about to be uninstalled. After uninstalling, the plugin configuration will be cleared. Please confirm your operation.

store.emptySelectHint: Select a plugin to preview detailed information
store.networkError: Failed to fetch plugin store. Please check your network connection and try again
store.placeholder: Search for plugin name, description, or keyword...
store.title: Plugin Store
